member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.BodyFrame.Dispose
member.summary: Call this method to free unmanaged resources associated with current instance.

remarks.para: Under the hood, reference counter is decremented on this call. When the references reach zero the unmanaged resources are destroyed. (Multiple objects of can reference one and the same body frame. For details see .)
Can be called multiple times but event will be raised only once.

member.name: P:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.BodyFrame.BodyIndexMap
member.summary: Gets the body index map: image in format, one byte per pixel, pixel value: zero-based index of a detected body or for background pixels.

remarks.para: Body Index map is the body instance segmentation map. Each pixel maps to the corresponding pixel in the depth image or the IR image. The value for each pixel is byte and represents which body the pixel belongs to. It can be either background (value ) or the zero-based index of a detected body.
For this reason, if you want to keep returned for longer life time than life time of object, use method.

member.exception: This property cannot be called for disposed objects.

member.summary: Control the temporal smoothing across frames.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.NativeApi.TrackerEnqueueCapture(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.TrackerHandle,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.CaptureHandle,K4AdotNet.Timeout)
member.summary: Add a Azure Kinect sensor capture to the tracker input queue to generate its body tracking result asynchronously.
member.param: Handle to a sensor capture returned by from Sensor SDK. It should contain the depth data for this function to work. Otherwise the function will return failure.

Specifies the time the function should block waiting to add the sensor capture to the tracker process queue. is a check of the status without blocking. Passing will block indefinitely until the capture is added to the process queue.
member.returns: if a sensor capture is successfully added to the processing queue. If the queue is still full before the timeout elapses, the function will return . All other failures will return .
member.remarks:
Add a Azure Kinect capture to the tracker input queue so that it can be processed asynchronously to generate the body tracking result. The processed results will be added to an output queue maintained by instance. Call to get the result and pop it from the output queue. If the input queue or output queue is full, this function will block up until the timeout is reached.
Upon successfully insert a sensor capture to the input queue this function will return success.
This function returns when either the tracker is shut down by API, or an internal problem is encountered before adding to the input queue: such as low memory condition, not containing the depth data, or other unexpected issues.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.NativeApi.TrackerPopResult(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.TrackerHandle,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.BodyFrameHandle@,K4AdotNet.Timeout)
member.summary: Gets the next available body frame.
member.param: If successful this contains a handle to a body frame object.
Specifies the time the function should block waiting for the body frame. is a check of the status without blocking. Passing will block indefinitely until the body frame becomes available.
member.returns: if a body frame is returned. If a body frame is not available before the timeout elapses, the function will return . All other failures will return .
member.remarks:
Retrieves the next available body frame result and pop it from the output queue in the . If a new body frame is not currently available, this function will block up until the timeout is reached. The SDK will buffer at least three body frames worth of data before stopping new capture being queued by .
Upon successfully reads a body frame this function will return success.
This function returns when either the tracker is shut down by API and the remaining tracker queue is empty, or an internal problem is encountered: such as low memory condition, or other unexpected issues.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.NativeApi.TrackerShutdown(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.TrackerHandle)
member.summary: Shutdown the tracker so that no further capture can be added to the input queue.
member.remarks:
Once the tracker is shutdown, API will always immediately return failure.
If there are remaining captures in the tracker queue after the tracker is shutdown, can still return successfully. Once the tracker queue is empty, the call will always immediately return failure.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.Tracker
member.summary: Body tracker. The main class in Body Tracking component.

remarks.para: Processing is organized as pipeline with queues. Use to add new capture to processing pipeline. Use to extract processed capture and body data from pipeline.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.Tracker.#ctor(K4AdotNet.Sensor.Calibration@,K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.TrackerConfiguration)
member.summary: Creates a body tracker.
member.param: The sensor calibration that will be used for capture processing.
The configuration we want to run the tracker in. This can be initialized with .

remarks.para: Under the hood Body Tracking runtime will be initialized during the first call of this constructor. It is rather time consuming operation: initialization of ONNX runtime, loading and parsing of neural network model, etc. For this reason, it is recommended to initialize Body Tracking runtime in advance: .

Also, Body Tracking runtime must be available in one of the following locations: directory with executable file, directory with K4AdotNet assembly, installation directory of Body Tracking SDK under Program Files.

member.exception: Invalid value of : cannot be and . Because depth data is required for body tracking.
Invalid/unsupported characters in of .
Unable to find/initialize Body Tracking runtime or wrong path to DNN model specified in .

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.Tracker.Shutdown
member.summary: Shutdown the tracker so that no further capture can be added to the input queue.

remarks.para: Once the tracker is shutdown, method will always immediately return failure.
If there are remaining captures in the tracker queue after the tracker is shutdown, can still return successfully. Once the tracker queue is empty, the call will always immediately return failure.
This function may be called while another thread is blocking in or . Calling this function while another thread is in that function will result in that function raising an exception.

member.exception: Object was disposed.

member.summary: Creates new managed object that references exactly the same unmanaged object as original one.
member.returns: New managed object that references exactly to the same unmanaged object as original one. Not .

remarks.para: Under the hood, references counter is incremented during call to this method.
To release reference, that is decrement reference counter call method of object.
It helps to manage underlying object lifetime and to access object data from different threads and different components of application.

member.summary: DLL imports from k4a.h header file for native functions that are connected with logging.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.Logging.NativeApi.LoggingMessageCallback
member.summary: Callback function for debug messages being generated by the Azure Kinect SDK.
member.param: The context of the callback function. This is the context that was supplied by the caller to .
The level of the message that has been created.
The file name of the source file that generated the message.
The line number of the source file that generated the message.
The messaged generated by the Azure Kinect SDK.

remarks.para: The callback is called asynchronously when the Azure Kinext SDK generates a message at a that is equal to or more critical than the level specified when calling to register the callback.

This callback can occur from any thread and blocks the calling thread.This callback user must protect it's logging resources from concurrent calls. All care should be made to minimize the amount of time locks are held.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Logging.NativeApi.SetDebugMessageHandler(K4AdotNet.Logging.NativeApi.LoggingMessageCallback,System.IntPtr,K4AdotNet.Logging.LogLevel)
member.summary: Sets and clears the callback function to receive debug messages from the Azure Kinect device.
member.param: The callback function to receive messages from. Set to to unregister the callback function.
The least critical error the user wants to be notified about.
member.returns: if the callback function was set or cleared successfully. if an error is encountered or the callback function has already been set.

remarks.para: Call this function to set or clear the callback function that is used to deliver debug messages to the caller. This callback may be called concurrently, it is up to the implementation of the callback function to ensure the parallelization is handled.
Clearing the callback function will block until all pending calls to the callback function have completed.
To update , this method can be called with the same value and by specifying a new .

Logging provided via this API is independent of the logging controlled by the environmental variable controls K4A_ENABLE_LOG_TO_STDOUT, K4A_ENABLE_LOG_TO_A_FILE, and K4A_LOG_LEVEL. However there is a slight change in default behavior when using this function.By default, when \p k4a_set_debug_message_handler() has not been used to register a message callback, the default for environmental variable controls is to send debug messages as if K4A_ENABLE_LOG_TO_STDOUT= 1 were set. If this method registers a callback function before is called, then the default for environmental controls is as if K4A_ENABLE_LOG_TO_STDOUT= 0 was specified. Physically specifying the environmental control will override the default.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi
member.summary: DLL imports for most of native functions from record.h and playback.h header files.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordCreate(System.Byte[],K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.DeviceHandle,K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle@)
member.summary: Opens a new recording file for writing.
member.param: File system path for the new recording.
The Azure Kinect device that is being recorded. The device handle is used to store device calibration and serial number information. May be if recording user-generated data.
The configuration the Azure Kinect device was started with.
If successful, this contains a pointer to the new recording handle.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks:
The file will be created if it doesn't exist, or overwritten if an existing file is specified.
Streaming does not need to be started on the device at the time this function is called, but when it is started it should be started with the same configuration provided in .
Subsequent calls to will need to have images in the resolution and format defined in .

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordAddTag(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle,System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Adds a tag to the recording.
member.param: The handle of a new recording, obtained by .
The name of the tag to write.
The string value to store in the tag.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks:
Tags are global to a file, and should store data related to the entire recording, such as camera configuration or recording location.
Tag names must be ALL CAPS and may only contain A-Z, 0-9, '-' and '_'.
All tags need to be added before the recording header is written.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordAddImuTrack(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle)
member.summary: Adds the track header for recording IMU.
member.param: The handle of a new recording, obtained by .
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks: The track needs to be added before the recording header is written.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordAddAttachment(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.UIntPtr)
member.summary: Adds an attachment to the recording.
member.param: The handle of a new recording, obtained by .
The name of the attachment to be stored in the recording file. This name should be a valid filename with an extension.
The size of the attachment data buffer.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks: All attachments need to be added before the recording header is written.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordAddCustomVideoTrack(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.UIntPtr,K4AdotNet.Record.RecordVideoSettings@)
member.summary: Adds custom video tracks to the recording.
member.param: The handle of a new recording, obtained by .
The name of the custom video track to be added.

A UTF8 null terminated string containing the codec ID of the track. Some of the existing formats are listed here: https://www.matroska.org/technical/specs/codecid/index.html. The codec ID can also be custom defined by the user. Video codec ID's should start with 'V_'.
The codec context is a codec-specific buffer that contains any required codec metadata that is only known to the codec. It is mapped to the matroska CodecPrivate element.
The size of the codec context buffer.
Additional metadata for the video track such as resolution and frame rate.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks:
Built-in video tracks like the DEPTH, IR, and COLOR tracks will be created automatically when the API is called. This API can be used to add additional video tracks to save custom data.
Track names must be ALL CAPS and may only contain A-Z, 0-9, '-' and '_'.
All tracks need to be added before the recording header is written.
Call with the same to write data to this track.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordAddCustomSubtitleTrack(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.UIntPtr,K4AdotNet.Record.RecordSubtitleSettings@)
member.summary: Adds custom subtitle tracks to the recording.
member.param: The handle of a new recording, obtained by .
The name of the custom subtitle track to be added.

A UTF8 null terminated string containing the codec ID of the track. Some of the existing formats are listed here: https://www.matroska.org/technical/specs/codecid/index.html. The codec ID can also be custom defined by the user. Subtitle codec ID's should start with 'S_'.
The codec context is a codec-specific buffer that contains any required codec metadata that is only known to the codec. It is mapped to the matroska CodecPrivate element.
The size of the codec context buffer.
Additional metadata for the subtitle track.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks:
Built-in subtitle tracks like the IMU track will be created automatically when the API is called. This API can be used to add additional subtitle tracks to save custom data.
Track names must be ALL CAPS and may only contain A-Z, 0-9, '-' and '_'.
All tracks need to be added before the recording header is written.
Call with the same to write data to this track.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordWriteHeader(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle)
member.summary: Writes the recording header and metadata to file.
member.param: The handle of a new recording, obtained by .
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks: This must be called before captures can be written.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordWriteCapture(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.CaptureHandle)
member.summary: Writes a camera capture to file.
member.param: The handle of recording, obtained by .
The handle of a capture to write to file.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks:
This method will write all images in the capture to the corresponding tracks in the recording file. If any of the images fail to write, other images will still be written before a failure is returned.
Captures must be written in increasing order of timestamp, and the file's header must already be written.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordWriteImuSample(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle,K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImuSample)
member.summary: Writes an IMU sample to file.
member.param: The handle of recording, obtained by .
A structure containing the IMU sample data and time stamps.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks: Samples must be written in increasing order of timestamp, and the file's header must already be written. When writing IMU samples at the same time as captures, the samples should be within 1 second of the most recently written capture.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordWriteCustomTrackData(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle,System.Byte[],K4AdotNet.Microseconds64,System.Byte[],System.UIntPtr)
member.summary: Writes data for a custom track to file.
member.param: The handle of a new recording, obtained by .
The name of the custom track that the data is going to be written to.
The timestamp in microseconds for the custom track data. This timestamp should be in the same time domain as the device timestamp used for recording.
The buffer of custom track data.
The size of the custom track data buffer.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks: Custom track data must be written in increasing order of timestamp, and the file's header must already be written. When writing custom track data at the same time as captures or IMU data, the custom data should be within 1 second of the most recently written timestamp.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordFlush(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle)
member.summary: Flushes all pending recording data to disk.
member.param: The handle of recording, obtained by .
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks:
This method ensures that all data passed to the recording API prior to calling flush is written to disk. If continuing to write recording data, care must be taken to ensure no new time stamps are added from before the flush.
If an error occurs, best effort is made to flush as much data to disk as possible, but the integrity of the file is not guaranteed.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.PlaybackOpen(System.Byte[],K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackHandle@)
member.summary: Opens an existing recording file for reading.
member.param: File system path of the existing recording.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.PlaybackGetNextCapture(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackHandle,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.CaptureHandle@)
member.summary: Read the next capture in the recording sequence.
member.param: If successful this contains a handle to a capture object.
member.returns: if a capture is returned, or if the end of the recording is reached. All other failures will return .
member.remarks:
This method always returns the next capture in sequence after the most recently returned capture.
The first call to this method after will return the capture in the recording closest to the seek time with an image timestamp greater than or equal to the seek time.
If a call was made to that returned , the playback position is at the beginning of the stream and this method will return the first capture in the recording.
Capture objects returned by the playback API will always contain at least one image, but may have images missing if frames were dropped in the original recording. When calling , , or , the image should be checked for .

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.PlaybackGetPreviousCapture(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackHandle,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.CaptureHandle@)
member.summary: Read the previous capture in the recording sequence.
member.param: If successful this contains a handle to a capture object.
member.returns: if a capture is returned, or if the start of the recording is reached. All other failures will return .
member.remarks:
This method always returns the previous capture in sequence before the most recently returned capture.
The first call to this method after will return the capture in the recording closest to the seek time with all image time stamps less than the seek time.
If a call was made to that returned , the playback position is at the end of the stream and this method will return the last capture in the recording.
Capture objects returned by the playback API will always contain at least one image, but may have images missing if frames were dropped in the original recording. When calling , , or , the image should be checked for .

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.PlaybackGetNextImuSample(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackHandle,K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImuSample@)
member.summary: Read the next IMU sample in the recording sequence.
member.param: If successful this contains IMU sample.
member.returns: if a sample is returned, or if the end of the recording is reached. All other failures will return .
member.remarks:
This method always returns the next IMU sample in sequence after the most recently returned sample.
The first call to this method after will return the IMU sample in the recording closest to the seek time with timestamp greater than or equal to the seek time.
If a call was made to that returned , the playback position is at the beginning of the stream and this method will return the first IMU sample in the recording.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.PlaybackGetPreviousImuSample(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackHandle,K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImuSample@)

member.remarks:
This method always returns the previous IMU sample in sequence before the most recently returned sample.
The first call to this method after will return the IMU sample in the recording closest to the seek time with timestamp less than the seek time.
If a call was made to that returned , the playback position is at the beginning of the stream and this method will return the first IMU sample in the recording.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.PlaybackGetNextDataBlock(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackHandle,System.Byte[],K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackDataBlockHandle@)
member.summary: Read the next data block for a particular track.
member.param: The name of the track to read the next data block from.
The location to write the data block handle.
member.remarks:
This method always returns the data block after the most recently returned data block for a particular track.
If a call was made to which returned , then the playback position is at the beginning of the recording and calling this method with the same track will return the first data block in the track.
The first call to this method after will return the data block in the recording closest to the seek time with a timestamp greater than or equal to the seek time.
This method cannot be used with the built-in tracks: "COLOR", "DEPTH", etc... can be used to determine if a track is a built-in track.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.PlaybackGetPreviousDataBlock(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackHandle,System.Byte[],K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackDataBlockHandle@)

member.remarks:
This method always returns the data block before the most recently returned data block for a particular track.
If a call was made to which returned , then the playback position is at the end of the recording and calling this method with the same track will return the last data block in the track.
The first call to this method after will return the data block in the recording closest to the seek time with a timestamp less than the seek time.
This method cannot be used with the built-in tracks: "COLOR", "DEPTH", etc... can be used to determine if a track is a built-in track.

member.summary: Seek to a specific timestamp within a recording.
member.param: The timestamp offset to seek to relative to .
Specifies how the given timestamp should be interpreted. Seek can be done relative to the beginning or end of the recording, or using an absolute device timestamp.
member.returns: if the seek operation was successful, or if an error occurred. The current seek position is left unchanged if a failure is returned.
member.remarks:
The first device timestamp in a recording is usually non-zero. The recording file starts at the device timestamp defined by , which is accessible via .
The first call to after this method will return the first capture containing an image timestamp greater than or equal to the seek time.
The first call to after this method will return the firs capture with all image timestamps less than the seek time.
The first call to after this method will return the first IMU sample with a timestamp greater than or equal to the seek time.
The first call to after this method will return the first IMU sample with a timestamp less than the seek time.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.PlaybackTrack.TryGetNextDataBlock(K4AdotNet.Record.PlaybackDataBlock@)
member.summary: Reads the next data block for this track.
member.param: Output: data block object on success or on EOF. Don't forget to dispose this object after usage.
member.returns: - if a data block is returned, - if the end of the recording is reached. All other failures will throw exception.

remarks.para: This method always returns the data block after the most recently returned data block for a particular track.
If a call was made to which returned , then the playback position is at the beginning of the recording and calling this method will return the first data block in the track.
The first call to this method after will return the data block in the recording closest to the seek time with a timestamp greater than or equal to the seek time.
This method cannot be used with the built-in tracks: "COLOR", "DEPTH", etc... property can be used to determine if a track is a built-in track.

member.exception: This method cannot be called for disposed playback object.

member.returns: - if a data block is returned, - if the start of the recording is reached. All other failures will throw exception.

remarks.para: This method always returns the data block before the most recently returned data block for a particular track.
If a call was made to which returned , then the playback position is at the end of the recording and calling this method will return the last data block in the track.
The first call to this method after will return the data block in the recording closest to the seek time with a timestamp less than the seek time.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.Recorder.Flush
member.summary: Flushes all pending recording data to disk.

remarks.para:
This method ensures that all data passed to the recording API prior to calling flush is written to disk. If continuing to write recording data, care must be taken to ensure no new time stamps are added from before the flush.
If an error occurs, best effort is made to flush as much data to disk as possible, but the integrity of the file is not guaranteed.

member.exception: Some error during recording to file. See logs for details.
This method cannot be called for disposed object.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sdk.TryInitializeBodyTrackingRuntime(K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.TrackerProcessingMode,System.String@)
member.summary: Call this method to initialization of Body Tracking runtime.
member.param: Processing mode for which Body Tracking runtime should be initialized.
If Body Tracking runtime was initialized successfully, this parameter is , otherwise it contains user-friendly description of failure reason.
member.returns: - if Body Tracking runtime was initialized successfully (in this case is ), - otherwise and in this case contains user-friendly description of failure.

remarks.para: It is rather time consuming operation: initialization of ONNX runtime, loading and parsing of neural network model, etc. For this reason, it is recommended to initialize Body Tracking runtime in advance and show some progress window for user. But this initialization is optional. If it wasn't called explicitly, it will be called implicitly during first construction of object.

This method tries to find Body Tracking runtime in one of the following locations: directory with executable file, directory with K4AdotNet assembly, installation directory of Body Tracking SDK under Program Files.

member.summary: Transform a 2D pixel coordinate with an associated depth value of the source camera into a 2D pixel coordinate of the target camera.
member.returns: The 2D pixel in coordinates or if does not map to a valid 2D coordinate in the coordinate system.

remarks.para: This function maps a pixel between the coordinate systems of the depth and color cameras. It is equivalent to calling to compute the 3D point corresponding to and then using to map the 3D point into the coordinate system of the .
If and are identical, the function immediately returns value of parameter and doesn't compute any transformations.

member.exception: is not a camera or is not a camera.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Calibration.ConvertColor2DToDepth2D(K4AdotNet.Float2,K4AdotNet.Sensor.Image)

member.param: The 2D pixel in color camera coordinates.
member.returns: The 2D pixel in depth camera coordinates or if does not map to a valid 2D coordinate in the depth coordinate system.
member.remarks:
This function represents an alternative to if the number of pixels that need to be transformed is small. This function searches along an epipolar line in the depth image to find the corresponding depth pixel. If a larger number of pixels need to be transformed, it might be computationally cheaper to call
to get correspondence depth values for these color pixels, then call the function .

has invalid format and/or resolution.
Cannot perform transformation. Most likely, calibration data is invalid.

member.param: The target camera or IMU sensor.

member.remarks: This function applies the intrinsic calibration of to compute the 3D ray from the focal point of the camera through pixel .The 3D point on this ray is then found using . If is different from , the 3D point is transformed to using . In practice, and will often be identical. In this case, no 3D to 3D transformation is applied.
member.exception: is not a camera.
Cannot perform transformation. Most likely, calibration data is invalid.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Capture
member.summary: A capture represents a set of images that were captured by a Azure Kinect device at approximately the same time.

remarks.para: A capture may have a color, IR, and depth image.A capture may have up to one image of each type. A capture may have no image for a given type as well.
Captures also store a temperature value which represents the temperature of the device at the time of the capture.

While all the images associated with the capture were collected at approximately the same time, each image has an individual timestamp which may differ from each other. If the device was configured to capture depth and color images separated by a delay, and will return a capture containing both image types separated by the configured delay.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Capture.Dispose
member.summary: Call this method to free unmanaged resources associated with current instance.

remarks.para: Under the hood, reference counter is decremented on this call. When the references reach zero the unmanaged resources are destroyed. (Multiple objects of can reference one and the same capture. For details see .)
Can be called multiple times but event will be raised only once.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ColorControlCommand
member.summary: Color sensor control commands.
member.remarks: Control values set on a device are reset only when the device is power cycled. The device will retain the settings even if the device is closed or the application is restarted.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ColorControlCommand.ExposureTimeAbsolute
member.summary: Exposure time setting.

remarks.para: May be set to or .

The Azure Kinect supports a limited number of fixed exposure settings. When setting this, expect the exposure to be rounded up to the nearest setting. Exceptions are 1) The last value in the table is the upper limit, so a value larger than this will be overridden to the largest entry in the table. 2) The exposure time cannot be larger than the equivalent FPS. So expect 100ms exposure time to be reduced to 30ms or 33.33ms when the camera is started. The most recent copy of the table 'device_exposure_mapping' is in https://github.com/microsoft/Azure-Kinect-Sensor-SDK/blob/develop/src/color/color_priv.h

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ColorControlCommand.AutoExposurePriority
member.summary: Exposure or Frame rate priority setting.
member.remarks: May only be set to . Value of 0 means frame rate priority. Value of 1 means exposure priority. Using exposure priority may impact the frame rate of both the color and depth cameras. Deprecated starting from version 1.1.0 of Sensor SDK. Please discontinue usage, firmware does not support this.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ColorControlCommand.Brightness
member.summary: Brightness setting.

remarks.para: Use extension methods from class for additional details on the field of view, and supported frame rates for each mode.
Binned modes reduce the captured camera resolution by combining adjacent sensor pixels into a bin.

member.summary: Starts color and depth camera capture.
member.param: The configuration we want to run the device in. This can be initialized with .

remarks.para: Individual sensors configured to run will now start to stream captured data.
It is not valid to call this method a second time on the same device until has been called.

member.exception: This method cannot be called for disposed object.
Configuration in is not valid. For details see .
Connection with device has been lost.
Cameras streaming is already running, or something wrong with , or library cannot be found.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Device.StopCameras
member.summary: Stops the color and depth camera capture.

remarks.para: The streaming of individual sensors stops as a result of this call. Once called, may be called again to resume sensor streaming.
This function may be called while another thread is blocking in or . Calling this function while another thread is in that function will result in that function failing with exception.

member.exception: This method cannot be called for disposed object.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Device.StartImu
member.summary: Starts the IMU sample stream.

remarks.para: Call this API to start streaming IMU data. It is not valid to call this function a second time on the same device until has been called.
This function is dependent on the state of the cameras. The color or depth camera must be started before the IMU.

member.exception: This method cannot be called for disposed object.
Connection with device has been lost.
IMU streaming is already running or cameras streaming is not running.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Device.StopImu
member.summary: Stops the IMU capture.

remarks.para: The streaming of the IMU stops as a result of this call. Once called, may be called again to resume sensor streaming, so long as the cameras are running.
This function may be called while another thread is blocking in or . Calling this function while another thread is in that function will result in that function failing with exception.

member.exception: This method cannot be called for disposed object.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.ColorFormat
member.summary: Image format to capture with the color camera.

remarks.para: The color camera does not natively produce BGRA32 images. Setting value will result in higher CPU utilization.
Use only s that is applicable for color images. To check it you can call .

member.summary: Image resolution to capture with the color camera.
member.remarks:
Not all combinations of , and are supported. To check compatibility use
and .

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.DepthMode
member.summary: Capture mode for the depth camera.
member.remarks: To check compatibility of with use .

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.CameraFps
member.summary: Desired frame rate for the color and depth camera.
member.remarks: cannot be used with and . Use and to check compatibility.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.SynchronizedImagesOnly
member.summary: Only produce capture objects if they contain synchronized color and depth images.

remarks.para: This setting controls the behavior in which images are dropped when images are produced faster than they can be read, or if there are errors in reading images from the device.
If set to , capture objects will only be produced with both color and depth images. If set to , capture objects may be produced only a single image when the corresponding image is dropped.
Setting this to ensures that the caller receives all of the images received from the camera, regardless of whether the corresponding images expected in the capture are available.
If either the color or depth camera are disabled, this setting has no effect.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.DepthDelayOffColor
member.summary: Desired delay between the capture of the color image and the capture of the depth image.
member.remarks: A negative value indicates that the depth image should be captured before the color image. Any value between negative and positive one capture period is valid.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.WiredSyncMode
member.summary: The external synchronization mode.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.SubordinateDelayOffMaster
member.summary: The external synchronization timing.

remarks.para: If this camera is a subordinate, this sets the capture delay between the color camera capture and the external input pulse. A setting of zero indicates that the master and subordinate color images should be aligned.
This setting does not effect the 'Sync out' connection.
This value must be positive and range from zero to one capture period.
If this is not a subordinate, then this value is ignored.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.DisableStreamingIndicator
member.summary: Streaming indicator automatically turns on when the color or depth camera's are in use.
member.remarks: This setting disables that behavior and keeps the LED in an off state.

member.returns: if configuration is valid and can be used in . if configuration has some invalid or incompatible parameters.

member.name: P:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Image.DeviceTimestamp
member.summary: Get and set the image's device timestamp.

remarks.para: Returns the device timestamp of the image, as captured by the hardware. Timestamps are recorded by the device and represent the mid-point of exposure. They may be used for relative comparison, but their absolute value has no defined meaning.
supports implicit conversion to/from .

member.exception: This property cannot be called for disposed objects.

member.name: P:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Image.SystemTimestamp
member.summary: Get and set the image's system timestamp.

remarks.para: Returns the system timestamp of the image. Timestamps are recorded by the host. They may be used for relative comparison, as they are relative to the corresponding system clock.The absolute value is a monotonic count from an arbitrary point in the past.
The system timestamp is captured at the moment host PC finishes receiving the image.

On Linux the system timestamp is read from clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC), which measures realtime and is not impacted by adjustments to the system clock.It starts from an arbitrary point in the past. On Windows the system timestamp is read from QueryPerformanceCounter(), it also measures realtime and is not impacted by adjustments to the system clock. It also starts from an arbitrary point in the past.
supports implicit conversion to/from .

member.exception: This property cannot be called for disposed objects.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat
member.summary: Image format type.
member.remarks: Helpful extension methods for this enumeration type can be found in .

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.ColorMjpg
member.summary: The buffer for each image is encoded as a JPEG and can be decoded by a JPEG decoder.
member.remarks: Because the image is compressed, the stride parameter is not applicable. Each MJPG encoded image in a stream may be of differing size depending on the compression efficiency.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.ColorNV12
member.summary: NV12 images separate the luminance and chroma data such that all the luminance is at the beginning of the buffer, and the chroma lines follow immediately after.
member.remarks: Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory. Chroma has half as many lines of height and half the width in pixels of the luminance. Each chroma line has the same width in bytes as a luminance line.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.ColorYUY2
member.summary: YUY2 stores chroma and luminance data in interleaved pixels.
member.remarks: Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.ColorBgra32
member.summary: Each pixel of BGRA32 data is four bytes. The first three bytes represent Blue, Green, and Red data. The fourth byte is the alpha channel and is unused in the Azure Kinect APIs.
member.remarks:
Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.
The Azure Kinect device does not natively capture in this format. Requesting images of this format requires additional computation in the API.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.Depth16
member.summary: Each pixel of DEPTH16 data is two bytes of little endian unsigned depth data. The unit of the data is in millimeters from the origin of the camera.
member.remarks: Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.IR16
member.summary: This format represents infrared light and is captured by the depth camera. Each pixel of IR16 data is two bytes of little endian unsigned depth data. The value of the data represents brightness.
member.remarks: Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.Custom8
member.summary: Each pixel is a single channel one byte of unsigned data.
member.remarks: Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.Custom16
member.summary: Each pixel is a single channel two bytes of little endian unsigned data.
member.remarks: Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.Custom
member.summary: Custom image format. Used in conjunction with user created images or images packing non-standard data.
member.remarks: See the originator of the custom formatted image for information on how to interpret the data.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.NativeApi.DeviceGetCapture(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.DeviceHandle,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.CaptureHandle@,K4AdotNet.Timeout)
member.summary: Reads a sensor capture.
member.param: If successful this contains a handle to a capture object.

Specifies the time the function should block waiting for the capture. If set to , the function will return without blocking. Passing will block indefinitely until data is available, the device is disconnected, or another error occurs.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.NativeApi.ImageGetDeviceTimestamp(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.ImageHandle)
member.summary: Get the image's device timestamp in microseconds.
member.param: Handle of the image for which the get operation is performed on.
member.returns: If the is invalid or if no timestamp was set for the image, this function will return . It is also possible for to be a valid timestamp originating from the beginning of a recording or the start of streaming.
member.remarks: Returns the device timestamp of the image, as captured by the hardware.Timestamps are recorded by the device and represent the mid-point of exposure.They may be used for relative comparison, but their absolute value has no defined meaning.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.NativeApi.ImageGetSystemTimestamp(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.ImageHandle)
member.summary: Get the image's system timestamp in nanoseconds.
member.param: Handle of the image for which the get operation is performed on.
member.returns: If the is invalid or if no timestamp was set for the image, this function will return . It is also possible for to be a valid timestamp originating from the beginning of a recording or the start of streaming.
member.remarks:
Returns the system timestamp of the image. Timestamps are recorded by the host. They may be used for relative comparison, as they are relative to the corresponding system clock.The absolute value is a monotonic count from an arbitrary point in the past.
The system timestamp is captured at the moment host PC finishes receiving the image.
On Linux the system timestamp is read from clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC), which measures realtime and is not impacted by adjustments to the system clock.It starts from an arbitrary point in the past. On Windows the system timestamp is read from QueryPerformanceCounter(), it also measures realtime and is not impacted by adjustments to the system clock. It also starts from an arbitrary point in the past.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.Sensor.WiredSyncMode
member.summary: Synchronization mode when connecting two or more devices together.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.WiredSyncMode.Standalone
member.summary: Neither 'Sync In' or 'Sync Out' connections are used.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.WiredSyncMode.Master
member.summary: The 'Sync Out' jack is enabled and synchronization data it driven out the connected wire.
member.remarks: While in master mode the color camera must be enabled as part of the multi device sync signaling logic. Even if the color image is not needed, the color camera must be running.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.WiredSyncMode.Subordinate
member.summary: The 'Sync In' jack is used for synchronization and 'Sync Out' is driven for the next device in the chain. 'Sync Out' is a mirror of 'Sync In' for this mode.
